last_episode_to_air.name: Episode 9
last_episode_to_air.overview: As the operation crumbles, the team works to destroy all their evidence. The police are closing in, but Makoto tries to act like everything's fine.

name: SCAMS
overview: Hit hard by the Lehman shock, a well-meaning young man joins a phone scam operation and gets increasingly embroiled in the underworld.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: After losing his corporate job, Makoto is broke and increasingly in debt. With no prospects and nowhere to turn, he takes up a suspicious offer.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: Makoto begins a hellish training program for new-hires. Unlike the other trainees, he knows this work is illegal, but he’s determined to keep the job.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: The elderly are hoarding money, and they’re a cancer on Japan. Hearing this, Makoto throws himself into defrauding seniors, but he feels conflicted.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: Pressured into expanding his operation, Kanbe asks Makoto to lead the team. Despite the impossibly high monthly quota, Makoto relishes his new role.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: After a dangerous encounter with Yamada, Makoto realizes he's in too deep to quit. His increasingly suspicious mother confronts him.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: Harassed by the elderly in her job as a home care worker, a fed up Sachiko decides to support Makoto in his misdeeds and provides him with client data.

episodes.name: Episode 7
episodes.overview: Makoto fears a teammate may be connected to the burglaries targeting Sachiko's client list. He decides to call it quits once he meets his quota.

episodes.name: Episode 8
episodes.overview: After finding out that Seimiya was involved in the burglaries, Dokugawa accuses Makoto of also being an accomplice.

episodes.name: Episode 9
episodes.overview: As the operation crumbles, the team works to destroy all their evidence. The police are closing in, but Makoto tries to act like everything's fine.
